reviewText:
Egg returns home 10 / 10
Steam / PC

Platforming as an egg has never been so much fun. Timing the egg wobble just right doesn't take long and is deeply satisfying, I can now be the Egg I have always dreamed of, and so can you. One very interesting mechanic is moving forward by jumping backwards; you can't do this on a skateboard - you need an egg; so if you ride a skateboard then you need this game. I have mastered the physics of eggs and life now feels complete.

Delightfully short levels, the casual playthrough took 1 hour. Hardcore playthrough took 3 hours. 100% Achievements in 4 hours. The sound track is an audio smoothie; 6 relaxing concertos written by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart.

Caviat Emptor: In hardcore mode there are two levels which require 99% luck and brute force perseverence at one hundred respawns each !

Buy this if you want delighfully simple platforming game with the physics of an egg, easy to pick up and hard to put down.

2015 Nov

reviewText: I was promised a Simple Platformer." Instead I got a game that is really frustrating! It levels of frustration this game causes me reminds me of VVVVV. The controls are pretty strange as well

voteText: "Simple Platformer" can be interpreted in at least three ways. It's a really hard game to play
helpfulPercent: but the concept is really simple
votesHelpful: and the controls are really simple.\n\nThe only technical error I came across was that I can high-jump through the portal beams (I imagine I'm jumping over the hitbox that registers that I went inside the beam). It would also be nice if the controls could be changed. It's strange having 'a' and 'd' for the move keys
votesTotal: and then pressing 'f' to do a high jump.\n\nWith that being said

reviewText: Okay let me break it down. You play as an egg. This egg in particular has a mustache. The goal is to reach the teleporter at the end of the level. reviewText: This is one of those masochistic platformers, except without the thing that makes them bearable (good controls!)  What should be an eggcellent idea ends up being a pretty disappointing trudge through an extremely short and uninteresting game.  To top it off, the devs added a hard mode" which was just the default mode from the game's launch

reviewText:
I bought this game in the sale for 0,51€, for 3,99€ i wouldn't recommend it.
I played the game 1 hour and 45 minutes, got all achievements and played both difficulties,  Casual  and  Hardcore . That is a little bit less i would expect for 3,99€. The only reason i got more playtime are the Trading Cards.
The controls are a little weird but you will get used to it.
The Casual Difficulty is pretty easy and the Hardcore difficulty uses the same levels but more traps and they are longer.
They use the music from Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, thats maybe a contra for you if you really hate Classic.
But thats pretty much it. I had fun while playing this little funny platformer and i hope i could help you decide to buy or not to buy this game.

reviewText:
Crap Invades Home	This game is kidding you!
You play as an egg 40 levels of jump'n'run but actually it's only jump and no run. You can't move in this game, however, you can jump right and left. Well, this probably sounds easy if you play with a ball but it isn't if you play with an egg. You can click like 10 times right arrow key and the egg will still move left. The egg rolls sometimes, then it's quiet easy to play with it but mostly you have to fight for each centimeter the egg 'moves'.
Besides that a game should make fun but in this game it's more a relief if you finished a level than the joy that you achieved something.
So, a game in which dieing is the main part (got the achievement Die. Respawn. Repeat." for which you have to die 1000 times after an hour...) and no story in it: GG"

reviewText: Very simple yet hard 2D platformer". You cannot move but slightly hop to the left or right. You got to use the momentum gained by the egg shape of your protag to jump over gaps and spikes. It's really innovative and refreshing but the lack of control drives you crazy by the later levels. It boils down to a lot of luck and fiddling around until you position your egg just in the right position to even get a chance at beating the level. Too frustrating and too few variation in gameplay and challenge."

reviewText: Lets go ahead and get the negatives out of the way: This is very difficult to control, the jumping noise can get a bit repetative, and sometimes the hitboxes feel a bit too big. However, I assume the control issues were intentional. You are playing as an egg, and if you have ever tried to make an egg roll in a way you want it to, you should know that this is a nearly impossible task. The levels are simple, but frankly if they weren't this game would be getting a bad review. It may be challenging, but it isn't impossible. Nothing that you have to do is more precise than you can manage. As far as plot goes, it couldn't me more simple. You are an egg, you want to return home. Also there's some guy who wants you dead or something.

reviewText: I picked this one up on sale at a pretty steep discount a while back, and I think this might be one of the rare instances where I (almost) wish I had paid full price. In a nutshell, the game is fun, challenging, and at times incredibly frustrating. Finishing it was both satisfying and kind of relieving. I don't think I'll play again since I finished it on both difficulties, but it was a good way to spend an evening. I've certainly spent more money on things that didn't keep me nearly as entertained. If you like platformers that are both unique and challenging, I definitely recommend this game.

reviewText:
This isn't a bad game, it's just incredibly annoying.

This isn't your standard kind of platforming. Sure, like many other platformers it makes you hate the developer each time you play, shouting sadist whenever you hit those damn spikes, but the mechanics are utterly fu... different.

Rolling around as an egg is quite a challenge. Completing casual was frustrating but doable, completing hardcore is just a yolk, hehe. Only for hard-boiled players.

EDIT: Finished every level on hardcore. It is doable, though indeed a few levels really rely on luck. Overall my experience with this game has been positive, though challenging. :)

reviewText: Egg returns home is a quaint rage platformer that will give you an immense hatred towards eggs. With clunky controls and the simplist objective, you will find yourself slamming your desk and or attacking something. Small level selection with linear routes of completion, this game wasn't all that fun to play. The music was also just ripped off classical so no bonus points there either. You're better off just googling a similar arcade game...
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
First off I'd like to clarify that in the 90 minutes I've played this game I have already 100%'ed it, so if that's not already put you off, then continue reading.


Oh my, what a shitastrophe.

Do NOT get this game if it's full price, I'd hardly say it's worth it at this discounted one.

This is less of a game, and more of a test of patience; controls are purposely clunky to create completely unnecessary difficulty. I admit there is a certain skill to timing your presses for the most height/distance possible, however even this is limited due to poor level design (e.g. low ceilings which make some levels horrific without any effort).

There are three buttons: jump left, jump right, and 'jump higher', however that last one is more of a 'hold down almost all of the time, otherwise game is impossible' button, and sometimes you'll find that even with the button down your egg will simply fling itself into the spikes shell-first.

Overview: REALLY short game, mostly luck-based gameplay, humour of being egg wore off after 3 minutes.

Rating: 3 rotten eggs out of 10

reviewText:
One moment, one mistake, one egg.
If you're looking for a game that will test your platform-game skills, look no further.

In this game, you play as a swanky egg who, after a small mishap with a teleporter, is trying to find his way home. How will this egg get home, you ask? Through 40+ levels of pure hell. Jump through spikes, traps, and pits with only your egg-physics and persistence to carry you through. Pray to RNGesus as a certain tyrannical spectator sends his side-scrolling wall of death toward you with the ultimate goal of ridding your existence from the face of the eggy-Earth. This game has the ability to make you scream great warsongs of rage, but it can also make you cry tender tears of pure bliss. Do all of this with a wonderful sountrack playing in the background, sure to soothe any lost and broken soul.

So, do you think you have what it takes to help an egg return home?

What I thought of the game!
Overall, I thought the game was a very enjoyable experience. Anyone who knows me knows that I am terrible at platform games, so this game was a real challenge for me... A challenge that I have beat! I will try to expand a bit on some of the things I liked the best about this game which include the story, the music, and the physics.

Those who have played this game may be thinking, What? There's a story to this game?" To that
recommended: "Yes! There is!" This game features a very simple
voteText: and wordless story about an egg who made a silly mistake and just wants to go home. It's very hard to not sympathize with this poor egg
helpfulPercent: but it's also hard to not chuckle a bit at his situation!\n\nI know I'm biased
votesHelpful: but the music is great! Sometimes I leave the game open in the background just to listen to it! I never thought I would be hearing Mozart's Oboe Concerto in a game like this
votesTotal: but I guess it's just the little things that take the cake. I think the music is very fitting to the game as a whole; it gives the game a very quirky
votesFunny: yet sophisticated feel to it. Needless to say
commentsCount: great selection of music!\n\nFor the physics of this game
column16: all I can say is kudos to the developer. When I first started playing
column17: I thought this game would be fairly simple because the egg would roll and jump like a ball... but I was horribly wrong. You play as an egg! Therefore
column18: you roll and jump how an egg would! This offers a whole set of challenges and setbacks that you would have never even thought of experiencing. Sometimes when you try to move to the right
column19: the way your egg-body is angled causes you to move to the left instead. Or maybe you are trying to jump over a large pit and need to gain enough momentum to make the leap... let's just say
column20: good luck on timing that jump! I truly think that out of all the good things this game has going for it
column21: the use of egg-physics is simply the best of them.\n\nSo
column22: if you have a few bucks to spare
column23: I'd definately recommend adding this game to your collection! It's a simple
column24: fun game that offers very thoughtful challenges and plently of rage-quits.\n\nTL;DRThis game is 70% rage

reviewText:
I usually do not enjoy platformers but this one is unique.  Only three buttons are used to control the egg.  Sometimes it can be frustrating to wobble and bounce your egg over spikes and holes in the ground but it still is fun.  I was never frustrated enough to quit the game like some platformers.  It could be because of the Mozart/Beethoven music they chose or the how levels end exactly at the right spot.  The graphics are not bad either; they may be plain but are attractive.  Also the alternative ending is hilarious.

Pick this game up, whether it’s on sale or not.

reviewText: When I say great platformer
date: what comes to mind? For me, I would think of Donkey Kong Country, Super Mario Bros. and maybe Super Meat Boy. And what exactly do these great platformers have in common? Many things of course, but most importantly, tight controls. These games may be hair-pullingly difficult at times, but they're fair because not only have they actually been play-tested, but they allow the gamer to feel like the death was their fault. Does Egg Returns Home" have tight controls? No. Does "Egg Returns Home" have fair deaths? No. This piece of garbage relies wholeheartedly on luck as the basic mechanic between failure and success
recommended: and that is the last thing any platformer (a game genre based on skill)

reviewText:
I brought this game because it looked fun and challenging, the game is neither. The controls are difficult to use, sometimes even jamming so I have to restart the level or die before I can move again.

The game is hard, a challenging game is difficult but involves skill to beat, this game is mostly luck based. I can sometimes jump higher when I'm not holding F (The key that apparently makes you jump higher) and when trying to go left (or right) I go in the opposite direction.

The game was fun for the first few levels, but constantly dying gets tiresome very quickly. In most platformer games when you die on a level, it's for a reason, lack of skill or accidental, but as you know where you died, you can easily avoid doing it again; with this game, you'll die multiple times in the same place because of how exact you must be when moving, even the smallest of mistakes will kill you, which is irritating as you don't get to decide to high you jump.

reviewText: Just terrible. A game with simplicity, and it barely functions. It uses 3 keys and the physics in-game are mental. Recieved this as a gift, looked neat and had a nice package. Then i loaded it up. I dont understand how momentum doesnt apply in a game about using force and timing fall so short. The A key moves the egg left, the D key moves it right, holding the F key gives greater height. Dont be fooled, if you roll too quick, you cant shift direction either mid air or on the ground. If on your eggs side, you cannot build momentum without backtracking, and will simply hop about in place.\n\nMaybe im being critical, i dont know. Not really worth dedicating time into. With thousands upon thousands of steam titles, this one can be ignored. Nobody will be missing much. I assume this game is a mobile port, or intended for mobile only.
